question.answer: Rhetoric - and Theater, Dance and Performance Studies (TDPS)
Sure, why not? i haven't had one in a while. i get kind of nervous though, and i don't act like my usual self . .
midway down my back. It'll probably be shorter when i finally get curls
When i was a freshman, i had heard of it through a friend and decided to check out the validity of this otherworldly haven in which theatre and Asians coexisted.

i like to eat. A LOT. It can be embarassing at times. Throughout my life, i've been endowed with such nicknames as Piggy, Oink Oink, Seconds, and Garbage Disposal. Hobby #2 varies from season to season. Right now, i've returned to my drawing phase.
My family. What can i say? i'm a selfless person. i mean, i guess i could say i live for myself but then who would i be without my family? Viva la CHO!
At the moment, i love "Alphabet Song" by Goh Nakamura which fits within a neat 3 min 33 sec. (Thanx to Hellen who introduced me to his music!)

Maybe somewhere around 250. It's frickin' old but feasible, i think. And being Asian and all, i'll probably look like a spry 180-year-old at the most. It'd be kool to end up in the Guinness Book of World Records for something.
No, i wouldn't pilfer it. i care about Rice too much. (i'm selfless, remember?) i'd buy us a much-needed warehouse and a bus and maybe our own theatre (even though 155 Dwinelle has its charms).

i'm not sure which object is the most evil, but i'd venture to say my ghetto laptop comes pretty close. The only reason i don't destroy it by beating with a baseball bat or throwing it out my window is that it's going to die on its own any second now.
